definition: less capable than desirable (idiom); not as strong as one would wish/the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak

from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor

sentences.english: He made manful effort to the heavy furniture , but failed .
sentences.chinese: 他花了極大的力氣想那個沈重的傢俱，但力不從心。

sentences.english: He makes manful effort to the heavy furniture , but fail .
sentences.chinese: 他花了極大的力氣想那個沈重的傢俱，但力不從心。

sentences.english: Too ill to get out of bed, she had strong feelings of uselessness.
sentences.chinese: 由於疾病纏身，臥牀不起，她深深感到力不從心。

sentences.english: After he failed in business, his family had great difficulty keeping up an appearance.
sentences.chinese: 他經商失敗以後，他一家人想擺闊便感力不從心了。

sentences.english: Huang Chang wants to dodge being looked, meager the competence to act.
sentences.chinese: 黃裳想要躲閃，已是力不從心。

sentences.english: Despite being powerful in the Force, Anakin always found this difficult.
sentences.chinese: 儘管阿納金原力很強，卻總感力不從心。

sentences.english: Even if Sun Zhengyi would like to conduct a large-scale mergers and acquisitions, but also powerless.
sentences.chinese: 即使孫正義想進行大規模併購，也是力不從心。

sentences.english: Learning French is easy，but Korean is out of my league.
sentences.chinese: 學習法語簡單，但是學韓語我就力不從心了。

sentences.english: The government used to be keen on overhauling education but it has run out of puff.
sentences.chinese: 儘管政府熱衷於教育檢討，但是他們已經力不從心。

sentences.english: If I overindulge I be to imagine of past hungers.
sentences.chinese: 力不從心時，我回想過去的完成。

sentences.english: In the past thirty or forty every day I can see a patient, now powerless.
sentences.chinese: 以前我每天能看三四十個病人，現在力不從心了。

sentences.english: José rendered the mule powerless and brought her safely to the corral.
sentences.chinese: 何提供的騾子力不從心和安全帶來了她的畜欄。

sentences.english: Sangxiao immediately tried to sit up, but was too weak to make it.
sentences.chinese: 桑曉立刻想坐起身來，可他已經弱得力不從心了。

sentences.english: The competitors were prostrated by the heat.
sentences.chinese: 競賽者們由於天氣炎熱而力不從心。

sentences.english: I feel keenly that my ability falls short of my wishes.

definition: man of Qǐ fears the sky falling (idiom); groundless fears
to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
not knowing which course to follow (idiom); at a loss what to do
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
bored/fed up with sth/sick of sth
